page.title: 02THE RACE COURSE
page.content: The first race was held in 1783 although there was no stand until 1788.The first race was won by a 4 year-old called Puff.Things went smoothly until 1805 when the racecourse owner,a local farmer, threatened to plough it up, because the Jockey Club had not paid its rent of a quarter of a pipe of wine (27 gallons) for the previous seasons racing.This hurdle was overcome when the Jockey Club sent in a navy pressgang eager to find recruits for the Napoleonic war;this scared the farmhands into running away so the farmer had no one to do the ploughing. The stand was destroyed by fire started by a tramp.The new stand was built in 1964.The whole racecourse is on top of the Downs, 2 miles long and horseshoe shaped. Nowadays fairs and markets are held there.
